title: Law & Economics of Corporate Bankruptcy & Insolvency
description: This course looks at the economic foundations of corporate bankruptcy and insolvency law. The course will discuss the application of general law-and-economics principles to the governance and reorganization of insolvent and financially distressed business firms. Readings will focus in particular on questions about whether and how general theories of contracts, property, and corporate governance must be amended in the context of insolvency and bankruptcy.
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent
preclusion: LL4441V/LL5441V/LL6441V Law & Economics of Corporate Bankruptcy & Insolvency
